Portal remains one of the most influential games ever to be released. Not only did it inspire an entire generation of puzzle games, it remains in pop culture as a very relevant game and story. Its use of visual storytelling intrigues and captures the player so that even though the game itself is very short with very little dialogue and story, it is nearly impossible to not become invested in the world and characters, of which there are 2, maybe 3.
Look no further than the fact that the companion cube, a literal box with a heart as its only disconcernable difference from any other box, is one of the most iconic pieces in all of gaming. That is how good the writing and design of this game is. The fact that there are only two things that have dialogue, and a box is still so memorable is really all you need to know about how good this game is.
If you have not played Portal before, it continues to be one the best puzzle games of all time. It would be worth it alone to play through and understand where so many video games found their inspiration. However, this game is truly one of the best of all time, and holds up even though it is approaching 15 years old. Nothing about this feels dated, except maybe the loading times between levels. Portal continues to be well worth the time to play through its short campaign.

Short, but it's undoubtedly one of the most influential puzzle games ever made - and for good reasons. Even today, the game is a technical marvel (Valve really knew how to use their engine), and its humor just can't get old.
